citations.narrative:
The plastic wind/rain break for the cavy has been chewed and torn and no longer functions as a rain/wind break. This
section of plastic flap needs to be replaced to keep the shelter in good repair for the safety of the cavy.

The plastic PVC tubes used for guests to feed the crested porcupine and pigs needs to be cleaned. There is an
accumulation of debris down the tube that needs to removed on a frequent basis to keep the tube feeder clean for the
health of the animals.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have an environmental enhancement plan in place to promote the overall psychological well-being of
the birds at the facility. Exhibitors must develop, document and follow a species appropriate plan for the environmental
enhancement to promote the psychological well-being of the birds that is within industry standards and approved by the
attending veterinarian. This plan must be made available for future inspections.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within (2) more inspection(s) or by Dec 2, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The plastic wind/rain break for the cavy has been chewed and torn and no longer functions as a rain/wind break. This 
section of plastic flap needs to be replaced to keep the shelter in good repair for the safety of the cavy. 
3.129(b) 
   
Feeding. 
The plastic PVC tubes used for guests to feed the crested porcupine and pigs needs to be cleaned. There is an 
accumulation of debris down the tube that needs to removed on a frequent basis to keep the tube feeder clean for the 
health of the animals. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The facility does not have an environmental enhancement plan in place to promote the overall psychological well-being of 
the birds at the facility. Exhibitors must develop, document and follow a species appropriate plan for the environmental 
enhancement to promote the psychological well-being of the birds that is within industry standards and approved by the 
attending veterinarian. This plan must be made available for future inspections. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within (2) more inspection(s) or by Dec 2, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
